algorithm_technique: Greedy approach using prefix sums and tracking maximum delays between wizards for sequential potions.
problem_summary_simple: Calculate the minimum time for wizards to brew potions sequentially, considering skill and mana requirements.
problem_summary_technical: Calculate minimum brewing time by considering the maximum delay for each wizard on consecutive potions, using prefix sums of skills.
key_insights: The problem involves sequential processing where each wizard must finish their task before the next can start on the same potion.
The critical factor is the synchronization: a wizard can only start the next potion after finishing the current one AND the previous potion is ready for them.
The greedy strategy involves minimizing the maximum delay introduced by any wizard on any potion transition.
